comment._content:
I've been going through the LOC photos, and what makes them so fascinating are all of Wystan's comments and links. They would mean nothing without someone doing what it is he does, and I just wanted to say how much I, personally, appreciate all the time he has obviously spent, and I know many other people do, too.

Thank you. Please don't stop!

comment.author: 90927340@N00
comment._content: Brokaw's 1 E. 79th was Rose & Stone. The Dakota was Henry J Hardenbergh.

comment._content: Nice historycal view. Thanks and Regards.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
This is indeed the Brokaw residence on 5th Avenue at E.79th St., which was demolished in 1965. You can just see a peek of the Metropolitan Museum of Art on the left.  

Thanks for the heads up, and we will correct and expand the record when we update.

comment.author: 44124342494@N01
comment._content: Kristi, I hate to disagree but this is not a picture of the Brokaw residence, which was on Fifth Ave & 79th Street. This picture shown the mansion off Fifth and 80th Street. The Brokaw mansion would have been directly to the right of the  photographer, but off the frame. Other pictures included in this thread do show the Brokaw mansion.
